did.abstract: Collection contains chiefly a photostatic copy of a report of 1838 from Gaines, concerning national defense, emphasizing the importance of railroads, and criticizing reliance on defense works and fortifications. Included is a discussion of the systems he proposed in his CANALS AND TURNPIKE ROADS (1826), and the constitutional justification for his plan. Other items are a letter regarding the jewelry and estate of his wife, Myra Clark Gaines (1857), and a letter from Gaines to George Bomford regarding a requisition for supplies (1815).

bioghist.p: U.S. Army general; veteran of the War of 1812, the Seminole Wars, the Black Hawk War, and the Mexican American War.
